recovery.title: Reboot to Recovery
recovery.description: If you device did not reboot into Recovery, then, With the device powered off, hold Volume Up + Home + Power.

download.title: Reboot to Download Mode
download.description: If your device did not reboot to Download Mode, then press, and hold Volume Down + Home + Power, until you see the Warning about Custom OS installations, press Volume Up to Continue, then you may have to unplug and plug the USB cord back in.

boot.title: Reboot the device
boot.description: Hold down the Volume Down + Home + Power button until the device vibrates, then release all buttons.

twrp_unlock.title: TWRP unlock
twrp_unlock.description: Your device will boot Team Win Recovery Project (TWRP). If the screen is off, hit the power button once to light it up, then swipe the bar in the bottom to the right where it says to "Swipe to allow modifications."

twrp_sideload.title: TWRP sideload
twrp_sideload.description: Select "Advanced" and then "ADB Sideload". Check the boxes "Wipe Dalvik Cache" and "Wipe Cache" and then swipe the bar in the bottom where it says "Swipe to Start Sideload".

twrp_sideload_reboot.title: Sideload complete!
twrp_sideload_reboot.description: Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the sideload. Your device will reboot to the new OS next.

trlte_check.title: Unlock Bootloader
trlte_check.description: You need to ensure you have an unlocked bootloader, which can be tested by installing TWRP. The Verizon variant should be the only variant with a locked bootloader, click 'More...' for instructions to unlock your Verizon Note 4, there is currently no solution for unlocking the AT&T variant, Sorry. :(
